work-experience.job-description: TO   PRESENT   VIDEO   LICENSING   PLATFORM   CONNECTING  VIDEO   CREATORS   WITH   THE  WORLDS   LARGEST  CATALOG   OF   PRE -CLEARED   COPYRIGHTS   ALLOWING   GREATER  CREATIVITY  AND   INCREASED   YOUTUBE   REVENUE .         FOUNDER/CEO     Created   a  platform   for   video   creators   to   access   the   largest  catalog   of   pre-cleared   songs   in   the  world   by  negotiating   blanket   license   with  every   major   music   publishers   (and  larger   independent).   The   OnRamp   platform   allow   video  creators   to   choose   from   over   4   million   songs   and   using   our   platform   we   optimize   creator   content  while   protecting   all   rights  owners.  OnRamp   will   monetize   video   content   while   digitally   distributing   audio   files   to   all   the   streaming   services   (and   iTunes).  We   facilitate   targeted   brand   advertising  campaigns   around   individual   songs   as   well   as   individual  artists.   We   work   directly   with   and   add   value   to   Multi-Channel   Networks,   Music   Publishers,   Record   Companies   and   YouTube.       MAKER  STUDIOS      LOS   ANGELES,   CA /NEW   YORK,   NY   2012

A   CUTTING -EDGE  MEDIA  COMPANY  THAT   BRIDGES   THE   GAP   BETWEEN   YOUTUBE   AND  TV.         GENERAL   MANAGER/MUSIC     Built   and   enhanced   the   administrative   infrastructure   for   the   largest   digital   media   segment   of   the   company   which   integrated   both   vertically   and   horizontally   across   the   network.    Developed   protocol  to   prevent   infringement   and   to   protect   owned   intellectual   property   allowing   partner   channels   to  create   and  grow   exponentially   in   a   start-up   environment.     Ensured   the   proper   registration   of   copyrights,   digital  distribution   to   retail,  streaming   services  and   third   party   synchronization  licenses.     Negotiated   with   music   production   libraries   to   provide   5000   channels   with   low  cost   high  quality   production  music.   Negotiated   all   large   deals   with   high   profile   talent,   targeting   strategic   partnerships   and   onboarding   channels   into   the  network.     Negotiated   with   the   major   music   publishers   to   secure   licenses   for   their   catalogs   to   maximize   revenue   and   to   avoid   infringement.    Collaborated   with   talent  to   maximize   production   efficiencies   and   marketing   strategies   while   increasing   revenue   through   co-writes,   covers,   giveaways   and   other   initiatives.  Oversaw   channel   producers,   creating   an   integrated   social   media  strategy   to   increase   the   subscriber  base,   viewership   and   develop   their   brand.      Contributed   to   the   3,000%   increase   in   channel  content,  increasing   from   150   to   more   than   5,000   channels.      Contributed   to   the   4,000%   increase   in   monthly   views,  increasing   from   300   million   to   1.6   billion.      Instrumental   in   making   Maker   Studios  the   #1  Independent   Network   on   YouTube,  according   to   comScore,  by   building   the   infrastructure   enabling   exponential   growth.   SONGS   MUSIC   PUBLISHING      NEW   YORK,   NY   2009
A   SERVICE -ORIENTED,   INDEPENDENT   MUSIC   PUBLISHER .   PARTNER,   GENERAL   MANAGER      (2009

Instrumental   in   growing   the   business  by   identifying   copyright  catalogs   that  complemented   the   strategic   direction   of   the   start-up.    Coached   and   mentored   14   staff   members   in   negotiating   terms   for   acquisition   of   small   deals   and   was   hands-on  2   |   HARRY  D.   POLONER                                                                                                                                                         HPOLONER @GMAIL.COM     (917)   428-6286     in   negotiating   large   deals.    Orchestrated   the   integration,  implementation   and   launch   of   integrated   marketing   programs   to   promote   the   newly   acquired   copyrights.          More   than   doubled   the   size   of   the   total   business   by   identifying   and   negotiating   catalog   acquisitions   valued   at   more   than   $20  million.      Evaluated   more   than   50   potential   catalog   acquisitions,   ranging   in   value   from   $1M   to   $40M.        Spearheaded   the   strategic   initiative   to  evolve   the   global   royalty   administration   strategy,   shifting   it   from   third-party   administrators   to   direct   Sub   Publishing   administration   in   an   effort   to   streamline   revenue   globally.    RESERVOIR   MEDIA   MANAGEMENT      NEW   YORK,   NY   2007

A   BOUTIQUE   MUSIC   PUBLISHER   BOASTING   A   MULTI -GENRE,   HIT -DRIVEN  CATALOG .   SENIOR   VICE   PRESIDENT,   CREATIVE   Employee   #2,   created   administrative  infrastructure   for   this   start-up,   focusing   initially   on  the   competitive   Country   Music   market.     Created   company  systems   to   handle   administration,   licensing   and   royalty   collection.     Developed   and   negotiated   outsourcing/sub-publishing   partnerships   with   international   affiliates.     Provided   directions   with  outsourced   Synchronization   and  Advertising   resources   to   market,   promote   and   place   songs,   capitalizing   on  newly   created  revenue.         Grew  the   copyright   library   from   $0   to   $20   million   in   less   than   two   years   by   creating   new   revenue   opportunities   for   music   properties   including   securing   hard-to-get   placement   in   film   and   TV.          Secured   lucrative   copyrights   with   multiple   hit   songs   and   gold/platinum   records   and   numerous   ASCAP   and   BMI   awards.   ASCAP      NEW   YORK,   NY   2003

A   MEMBERSHIP   ASSOCIATION  OF   MORE   THAN  435,000   U.S.   COMPOSERS ,   SONGWRITERS ,   LYRICISTS ,   AND  MUSIC   PUBLISHERS   OF   EVERY  KIND  OF   MUSIC .   VICE   PRESIDENT,   MEMBERSHIP   GROUP   Spearheaded  the   membership   operation   representing   tens   of   thousands   of   songwriters.     Coached   a   team   to   plan   and   produce   national   outreach  programs   to   generate   positive   publicity   and   educate   the   local   music   industry   and   songwriting   community.   Partnered   with  major   and   independent   record   labels,   and   local   and   national   publications   in  marketing   initiatives.    Produced   35   entertainment   and   educational  events   per   year   and   secured   corporate  sponsors   in   order   to   promote   new   artists.         Grew  membership   15%   annually   by   transitioning   to  an  online   registration  process   and  guiding   the   staff   to  recruit,   sign   and   service   clients.      Created   the   Tribeca/ASCAP   Music   Lounge,  an   annual  music   event   at   the   Tribeca   Film   Festival   by   negotiating   terms   with   sponsor   and   organizing  artist   participation      Improved   morale,   effective   communications  and   employee   engagement   by   turning   around  a   dysfunctional   culture,   identifying   sources   of   negative  communications   and   redirecting   or  eliminating   instigators.   EMI   MUSIC   PUBLISHING      NEW   YORK,   NY   1995
REPRESENTS   THE  WORLD 'S  MOST   COMPREHENSIVE   CATALOGUE  OF   CONTEMPORARY   MUSIC   WITH   OVER   1.3   MILLION   SONGS .   VICE   PRESIDENT,   TALENT  ACQUISITION   AND   MARKETING
